content:
Thunderbird updater is simple a bit of code that installs with Thunderbird. I have never actually seen it running and was not aware it had any icon for the taskbar. But I can see it reverting settings to those chosen during setup. Although I might be a bug if it is removing things, lets look for a quick fix.

When Thunderbird initially installs there is an option to have a desktop and or a task bar icon. I am guessing you chose not to have the taskbar icon. Try reinstalling from Thunderbird.net and make sure the options for icons are set as you want. Nothing should change except your icons hopefully will no longer be wandering.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Try changing the default if you do not like it. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird#w_changing-default-threading-mode
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Ok, I have no quick solution, but I infer there was just an update to Thunderbird? If true, then the update may have lost your profile. My suggestion to pursue that would be to click help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profiles' and click 'about:profiles'. That takes you to a pane showing available profiles. One of them may be your profile prior to the upgrade.
creator: davidsk

content:
Ciao, se intendi la password principale di Thunderbird, non Ã¨ possibile recuperarla. Puoi rimuovere la password principale come spiegato qui -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/password-principale-thunderbird#w_rimuovere-la-password-principale ma se procedi dovrai reinserire a mano nome utente e password di tutti gli account.

se intendi la password di accesso al tuo account email memorizzate in Thunderbird, le puoi recuperare come spiegato qui -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/salvare-password-thunderbird#w_come-rimuovere-o-modificare-le-password

Se infine le password non sono mai state memorizzate in Thunderbird, devi rivolgerti a chi gestisce la tua casella email.

When opening a MAPI email with a recipient email, the last letter of the email address is cut off in its fancy drawn box.

Please file a bug report at https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/enter_bug.cgi?product=Thunderbird. Thanks.
creator: wsmwk

content: Try Ctrl++ and Ctrl+- to zoom in and out. Ctrl+0 (zero) to reset. Or, hold Ctrl while scrolling the mouse wheel.
creator: sfhowes

content: I may be misunderstanding your concern, but I think clicking 'unified folders' will accomplish much of what you want. That is set at the icon to the right of the 'new message' button. With unified folders, you can have just the inbox showing when that is all you want to see. If the message list pane shows the messages sorted to show newest at bottom, you can change that in table view' at the icon to the right of 'quick filter'
creator: davidsk

content: Right-click a folder in the Folder Pane and set it as a Favourite Folder, then View/Folders/Favourite Folders. Click the 3-dot icon to move Favourite Folders up or down.
creator: sfhowes

content: I am no Hotmail guru and @Matt has forgotten more than I shall ever know - but for now, if you post a screenshot of your SMTP settings, that might generate more ideas.
creator: davidsk

content: Several people have posted that concern. However, this is a support site staffed by volunteers. None of us have the authority to change any component. If you wish to communicate that higher up, you could post your concern at connect.mozilla.org. Thank you..
creator: davidsk

content:
There is a way to set the minimum height of the message list:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1424127
creator: sfhowes

content: OK, found the problem. Since Thunderbird had changed, Bitdefender had disallowed the newly installed software to function. I had searched the Bitdefender logs, to see if anything had happened, and I found the line denying Thunderbird internet access, due to the software change. I enabled Thunderbird to access the network, and all was well.
creator: umeweall1

content: So, how are you attempting to delete them? Highlighting and clicking delete? Are your messages being kept on server? You have that unticked, but you also have 'until i delete them ticked, so I'm unsure how that works, as I usually see the 'leave on server' ticked when that other one is ticked.

content: Just a possibility: try changing mailnews.tcptimeout to 240. You can do that at settings>general and scroll down to config editor at bottom of pane.
creator: davidsk

content:
Not sure if att.net accounts work with Yahoo servers, even if the service is based on Yahoo mail. Try the recommended settings, e.g. imap.mail.att.net, 993, generate a secure mail key, and use it in TB instead of the account password.

https://www.att.com/support/article/dsl-high-speed/KM1010523/
creator: sfhowes
